title: 103_s351
content: DEPOSITS IN CAPITAL CONSTRUCTION FUND ACCOUNT EXCLUDED FROM NET EARNINGS FROM SELF-EMPLOYMENT. The amendment to the Merchant Marine Act, 1936 involves reducing taxable income and net earnings from self-employment related to agreement vessels. Nonqualified withdrawals are subject to self-employment tax. The tax imposed by section 1401 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 shall be determined without regard to section 230 of the Social Security Act for nonqualified withdrawals. Conforming amendments are made to section 7518 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding taxable income and net earnings from self-employment attributable to the operation of agreement vessels. Nonqualified withdrawals subject to self-employment tax are addressed in the amendments. Nonqualified withdrawals subject to self-employment tax are addressed in the amendments, with the tax determined without regard to section 230 of the Social Security Act. If a nonqualified withdrawal includes deposits not reducing tax liability under section 1401, the tax benefit rule applies. The amendments address nonqualified withdrawals subject to self-employment tax, with tax determined without regard to section 230 of the Social Security Act. The amendments also provide for the treatment of earnings of ship contractors deposited in special reserve funds. Effective date for the amendments is for taxable years beginning after December 31, 1992. Refund or credit of any overpayment of tax resulting from the amendment made by subsection (a) must be claimed within 1 year of the enactment of this Act, even if barred by law.
